abstract: Citigroup said that it had persuaded a New York judge to temporarily block Wells Fargo from acquiring Wachovia.
snippet: Citigroup said that it had persuaded a New York judge to temporarily block Wells Fargo from acquiring Wachovia.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup announced late Saturday that it had persuaded a New York judge to temporarily block Wells Fargo from acquiring Wachovia, firing the first shot in what could be a prolonged legal battle.

headline.main: Citigroup Says Judge Suspends Wachovia Deal
headline.print_headline: Citigroup Says Judge’s Order Suspends Wachovia Deal

byline.original: By Eric Dash and Jonathan D. Glater

abstract: A New York state court judge temporarily halted Wachovia’s efforts to abandon deal talks with Citigroup in favor of a merger with Wells Fargo, escalating the battle over the Charlotte-based banking giant.
snippet: A New York state court judge temporarily halted Wachovia’s efforts to abandon deal talks with Citigroup in favor of a merger with Wells Fargo, escalating the battle over the Charlotte-based banking giant.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup announced late Saturday that it had persuaded a New York judge to temporarily block Wells Fargo from acquiring Wachovia, firing the first shot in what could be a prolonged legal battle, The New York Times’s Eric Dash and Jonathan D. Glater reported.

headline.main: Judge Puts Temporary Halt on Wachovia-Wells Fargo Deal

abstract: Citigroup‘s case against Wells Fargo and Wachovia is caught in a jurisdictional morass. On Saturday evening, Citi trooped up to New York Supreme Court Judge Charles E. Ramos’s Connecticut house to obtain a temporary restraining order.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup‘s case against Wells Fargo and Wachovia is caught in a jurisdictional morass. On Saturday evening, Citi trooped up to New York Supreme Court Judge Charles E. Ramos’s Connecticut house to obtain a temporary restraining order.
